title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=ae6b7a10fa3272821e9904431dab0b993b36aae7
comments:
Hello you gorgeous people,
 I am trying hard to remember a movie name if you could help, it was suggested me by a redditor 2 years back and op has deleted their messages. 

A South Indian movie don't know malyalam or Telugu or Tamil watched it with subtitles. 
The plot was about love from childhood to adult, starts with a kid who likes a girl in class who leaves, then as a teen there is other love story and after that he is working as clerk and loves a lady at workplace, it was a wonderful movie, the climax was the most goosebump part of it where he is talking to his lady on first night talking about all the love he been in through i don't want to give any spoilers, that night power goes and he asks his friend for a generator or something (side comedy part) ....please for the love of movies help with the name... I am restless.

Edit: typos
Started watching Never Have I ever s4

Watched Dahaad. The serial killer part was picked directly from one of the crime patrol episodes. Exact M.O., but the killer was from Maharashtra and targeted poor females that worked around construction sites.

Sonakshi Sinha, the guy who played the killer and Gulshan Devaiah were amazing. Much more amazing was the part where they connected the whole story with caste discrimination & women being forced into marriage after a certain age by their families.

But the biggest problem was the last part where the killer tells his motive. He says that he killed those women because they would easily get into a man and readily slept with them. No where during the whole series was he shown driven by any agenda. He was just a classic psychopath who killed for pleasure. That part just killed the whole series.

+++++++++++

Asur S2 was amazing. Shubh was created as an amazing villain.

What was great about this series was that they actually showed Anarchy taking place after India's financial system started collapsing. The villain was taking out future threats to his regime under the guise of mythology using AI.

I mean Fight Club ends where bombs start going off and anarchy begins.

Dark Knight Rises shows a bit, but we know if nothing the city which goes into anarchy will explode on day 30. Also most of the focus was on Bruce Wayne.

Captain America Winter Soldier: Exact same plan by Hydra. Develop a system to detect future threats to regime & eliminate them before hand. But it gets over just as it is about to begin.

Sacred Games: Again same plot by the cult. But we never see the anarchy happening if it even happens.

+++++++++++

Gumraah: Good movie, one time watch.

+++++++++++

Watched Rang De Basanti again after many years. But this time I watched it from Atul Kulkarni's character POV. It is a beautiful story of a political party worker blinded by hatred for modernity and a specific religion. But when he deep dives into India's freedom struggle as part of acting, realizes the importance of freedom, and meets more people his mind opens up. He starts empathizing more, starts understanding and accepting other people's opinions. In the end stands for what is right even if it means going against his party and leader.
